name: Queen's Landing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently got married on April 27, 2013 and had my wedding reception at Queen's Landing. I would like to tell any bride-to-be who is looking for a classy and upscale location and staff that Queen's Landing is definitely Niagara's finest. 14 months of planning with Lisa Javor, Queen' s Landing's very own wedding planner (with the booking of a wedding reception comes a wedding planner) It is very rare to find a younger woman nowadays who is professional from the very moment you make contact with her to the very end of the big day. Lisa and Queen's Landing's staff ALWAYS treated me with priority and respect. I never felt I had to hesitate with the number of e-mails or phone calls I placed with Lisa. Lisa had an answer and a solution for every question I had. Right down to finding out the brand of tea that was going to be served at my reception so I could properly indicate is on my menu card I was having custom made.
reviews.title: Wedding Reception in the Georgian Grand Ballroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heck! Even the waitress who served us during our menu tasting surprised me with a gift on the big day. I just can't get over the way Queen's Landing made me feel genuinely special.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Great Meeting, Great Staff!
reviews.text: A wedding day is more than the day itself. Planning my wedding was the greatest year of my life because I worked with people like Lisa and the Queen's Landing staff. Optimal food, service and venue. JOB WELL DONE!
Great place for a weekend away.
reviews.title: Sunday Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ambiance is great for couples or a few girlfriends getting together.
reviews.title: Poor value for money spent

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a great night at the Peller Estate, food truck eats function. We had a great time. We were there with 3 other couples who had a blast as well. The staff at the hotel were very nice and accommodating. Very quiet and relaxing location and close to the strip. The rooms are spacious and clean especially the bathroom. The hotel is older but they maintain it very nicely. The breakfast in the morning was very good, our overnighter went by too quick. The only complaint I have is that there weren't very many places to go or eat for a midnight snack.
reviews.title: Great get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of a trio of hotels in Niagara on the Lake, run by the Vintage hotels, which includes the Pillar and Post, Prince of Wales. As one might expect from a pricier hotel, the service was excellent, and the facility well appointed. The facility is old, and at points shows its age. It is located near a harbor that opens onto the lower Niagara river. The view from the dining room overlooking the harbor and river was superb. Grounds were scrupulously maintained and filled wit florals and plantings of many varieties. Fountains and statuary were very nice. The interior was finely appointed. The library/computer room was stately. The staff was cheerful and friendly. When calling the front desk to help with operating the in-room Keurig, someone was sent up immediately, and was very helpful. Early morning coffee and tea outside the pool/exercise room area were a nice touch. A newspaper appeared outside the door in the morning. The room itself was clean, but noticed some dust around the feet of the desk. A sheet of glass that topped a nightstand was not properly secured with anti-slip disks, and thus slid around a bit. A number of channels on the T.V. were snowy. The bed was very comfortable. However, the bed pillows were not up to the level we would have expected from a facility of this price level. A bit lumpy, I suspect due to being filled with shredded memory foam. The patrons were a mix of nationalities and ages, with a bent towards an older, more sedate crowd.
reviews.title: Nice, but overpriced.

reviews.text: Another Great conference at Queens Landing - thanks to the staff including Peggy & Paul who met our every request with friendly and amazing service. The upgraded rooms were appreciated by our guests as well as the comfort of the beds. The location was great for our group to enjoy the Pillar & Post spa, golf and dinner at Navy Hall. Thanks to the serving staff at dinner for their attention to every detail and Doug - The Trolley Driver!! Overall 2 days enjoyed by all and we hope to see you again soon.
reviews.title: Another Great Conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel, excellent location, getting a little worn around the edges but staff very good, bar food ok, dining room Tiara at breakfast excellent, with attentive staff. Some rooms can be noisy so check first. We will be back,
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our wedding at Queen's Landing at the beginning of May. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect venue (QL) or location (NOTL). The reputation that QL has is certainly well deserved. It is located a block off the main street which makes it central, easy to find but also more intimate.
reviews.title: Wedding Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our venue at the Queen's Landing. Everything was perfect ! The food and service was excellent. Lisa, the wedding coordinator was very helpful and easy to get a hold of during the entire planning. Our guest really had a great time, and loved the location.We couldn't of picked a better venue. A must for any wedding/event.
reviews.title: May Wedding

reviews.text: We booked the Queen's Landing Hotel / Prince of Wales for a business conference (50 people). We were very pleased with how smoothly our event was executed. Staff were on hand to quickly take care of any last minute details. The staff were pleasant to work with. A last minute change in our timing was quickly accommodated by the business office without any fuss. Peggy was great; fun to deal with, smiling, calm, and organized. Our conference was held at the Queen's Landing Hotel. Our dinner was at the Prince of Wales. Lovely walk through the park between the two facilities. Dinner portions were a little too small, but the wait staff were great. The banquet coordinator Dan was excellent to deal with. We stayed overnight back at the Queen's Landing. Accommodation was lovely with nice soft beds and pillows. Had the Tiara restaurant in the Queen's Landing Hotel been able to accommodate our group for dinner we would have stayed there. Lunch and breakfast in the Tiara Restaurant were top notch. Overall I have to say food quality was better at the Queen's Landing (world's best gluten free brownies for the celiac in our group as well). AV Services were very very pricy, but the AV coordinator discounted our bill a bit, so that was nice of him. Didn't have time to test the spa services, but there's always next time.
reviews.title: Queen's Landing Conference

reviews.text: Just last week we had our company's annual meeting at the Queen's Landing. We had guests coming from different parts of the world and they all enjoyed the hospitality, the beautiful location and the excellent food. I would like to thank the entire staff and particularly the conference service manager Peggy Cernick who organized the event to perfection, down to the smallest detail. Thanks Peggy for everything, it was a pleasure working with you.
reviews.title: Great place to have a corporate event

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel from the outside, beautiful from the inside...worth the money? Not really. While the rooms were nice, ours had a view of the roof. Dinner was excellent, but the breakfast brunch disappointing - especially the coffee! Definitely look out for special deals, otherwise it's not worth the money!
reviews.title: Not worth the full price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dinner at the Tiara was excellent and room was the same.
reviews.title: Queens Landing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Queen's Landing over the long weekend and were so pleased with the experience. From the moment we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us some great recommendations on things to do and places to see, and the complementary shuttle to and from everywhere was the icing on the cake! We stayed in a King Suite with Fireplace and Jetted Tub and the room was beautiful. After a long day of biking the tub and bed were heavenly!
reviews.title: A wonderful long weekend escape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend Queen's Landing to anyone staying in Niagara on the Lake – we can’t wait to go back!
reviews.title: A GEM!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a wonderful 4 nights spent at this beautiful hotel. Our room was stunning ( we stayed in the "Dockmaster's Suite" and the service from every staff member we encountered was second to none.......a special shout out to Erin & Erikka whose exceptional service in the outdoor patio/lounge made our stay truly memorable.....will definitely be returning to this gem.
reviews.title: This is my second Vintage hotel at Niagara on the Lake

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and well situated. 5min. walk to Prince of Wales which is right on the strip.
reviews.title: Wedding-Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and comfortable. Same bathroom towel rack problem as Prince of Wales.
reviews.title: Perfect venue for a perfect day :)

description: Stately Georgian-style mansion overlooking the scenic Niagara River and Lake Ontario. #1 hotel in Ontario on Conde Nast Gold List 2010 and CAA/AAA Four Diamond Award for dining and accommodations. Conveniently located just a short walk from the town’s main street and Shaw Festival. 142 elegant guestrooms.
